The V69 Destroyer is a conventional-class backpack with unconventional features. They are more fully detailed than most packs in this class. In the tradition of our focus on practical field use, we've built the 60 liter (3660 cubic inch) V69 Destroyer and 99 liter (6050 cubic inch) V90 Battleship to be extremely capable and comfortable load bearing systems. Every feature and detail has a purpose, and many of them have multiple purposes.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Indiana Deer Legal Remington Model 700  350 JR
postcontent:
Two years ago it was illegal to hunt in Indiana with a rifle like this.
 Last year Indiana changed the casing length to 1.8 inches.  I have a gunsmith
 CF Gunworks LLC  that took  the 350 Remington Magnum  and shortened that casing to 1.8 inches
 Which is what this cartridge now is. You can’t  buy this ammo or the gun ,they 
 have to be custom made which is why they are expensive. The .357 and .44 magnums are just another example of Indiana Deer Legal cartridges that you can use. This is a High Powered Rifle that has been modified to meet Indiana specs and requirements . This rifle is 100 % legal to hunt with in Indiana .
Don’t wait for Deer season to decide you want one, you won’t be able to. This is someone’s chance to own
a very nice Indiana Deer Legal High Powered Rifle of which only a hand full are available.

I have a custom built Remington Model 700 That was a 350 Remington Magnum
it has been shortened to 1.8 inch. Indiana Deer Legal casing
the factory barrel has been bedded and set back to shorten the chamber.
It comes with Redding Dies that have been ground to match. 
I have brass and about 30rds of ammo that was made by C F Gunworks.
It is toped off with a leupold 3x9.
This rifle killed 3 deer at over 300yds this past season. It is amazing!!
I would like $1600 with scope or $1400 without.

This Rifle was custom built to Indiana Specs!!!!! And is referred to as a 350 JR
 This cartridge is modeled after the Remington 350 Magnum. They shorten the case
 to 1.8 inches, I took a picture so you can see the cartridge, bullet is 200grn
and clearly meets Indiana guide lines. I hope this helps with the confusion. 
Certain rifles like the .357 magnum or .44 magnum can be bought at walmart
and are perfectly legal. Indiana says you can't go below .357 magnum. This rifle can't
be bought at WalMart they have to be custom made which the price reflects

Nikko 512 with 26" rib vent barrels, top is modified bottom is improved. These were made in kodensha japan in the factory where winchester 101's were made. Incredible shotgun. Could only find one for sale online right now (at 700 and is not all original; the one I own is all original) Nikkos don't pop up often for sale. 

It has no import marks making them early models. 512 is from early 70's from research but it's tough as the Nikko company did not keep the same records other companies and the factory was demolished in the early 80's. 

I will gladly meet someone to take a look at either shotgun and send plenty of pictures upon request

title: For Sale:  SIG SAUER® P250
postcontent:
The P250®, a modular pistol that allows the shooter to change caliber and size at will.... The SIG SAUER® P250 was designed specifically to address the future needs of the military, law enforcement, and civilian shooters around the world. The P250 is available in the most popular calibers (9mm, .40S&W and .45ACP). The P250's innovative design enables the shooter to quickly remove the functional mechanism and place it into the polymer grip of his choice. This allows an immediate change in caliber and size;(subcompact, compact and full). And after any change the pistol delivers both outstanding accuracy and reliable functionality. Unlike other polymer based pistols the steel frame on the P250 controls the rearward motion of the slide- not the polymer grip. The result is both outstanding accuracy and reliable functionality even with lasers, lights, or other accessories mounted to the polymer grip's molded in accessory rail.

 Now you can own the world's only modular shooting system globally engineered to deliver the "To-Hell -And-Back-Reliability" you've come to expect from Sig Sauer.

On a personal note, I really like this pistol. It has a bobbed no snag hammer design and the smoothest D.A.O. trigger pull I have ever felt on any semi- auto pistol. 

Oh, and it's a Sig... Enough Said.

title: For Sale/Trade:  REMINGTON  11-96  Light Weight
postcontent: Remington 11-96......it's a new one on me too !!!  Never had I heard of the 11-96 prior to December of last year !!!  They were US made...(Remingtons North Carolina Plant).....and I am sort of thinking it was the predecessor to the VERSA MAX. It's like new,...two SMALL marks on the woodwork...all metal is 100 %. Shoots 2 3/4 and 3 inch shells. It includes all the choke tubes..(Skeet, Full, Modified, and Imp Cyl) and original packing box......I haven't even a box of shells through it......I did a little research and found out this 12-gauge autoloading lightweight, low-recoil shotgun.  Voted 1997 Shotgun of the Year by Shooting Industry magazine. . With Win AA traploads,...the felt recoil is about the same as a 20 gauge High brass load   NOT a lot of these available ANYWHERE,....(don't believe me....just check ALL of the Remington Automatic listings here on Armslist,......you won't find a one..NATION WIDE  !)..... I'm thinking that COLLECTORS have hogged them.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1986 SIG 226 - 4 mags - holster - NEAR MINT
postcontent:
I have a 1986 Sig 226 with mud rail cutouts.  This was the last gen of the mud rails.  For those do not know about the mud rails sig in 1985-86 cut out slits in the frame rail so that the gun would shoot with sand, mud, or water in it.   

The Mud rails came under scrutiny when guys were having the frame rail crack when using 9mm+P ammo.  Alot of these guns were ruined by this.  My frame is in MINT condition with NO/ZERO/NONE wear marks at all.  I keep it oiled,  I keep it greased, and I am not an idiot and I use the right ammo.  I also added the EFK Dragon Frame Saver recoil system to prevent this ever happening to my gun.  I have the SIG E2 grips added to this pistol as well.  

A Beautiful Tysons corner specimen, which is rare to find.  They dont make them like this anymore, GERMAN MADE.  Comes with 4 mags, a holster, and original grip parts.  



Will look at CASH offers.  Do not lowball me, and do not ask what I want, make an offer.

title: For Sale:  PSA upper mid length, FN CHF, YHM rail
postcontent:
I also have flip up sights, Troy rail covers, & folding forearm for $600 or can sell complete with a Anderson lower and magpul furniture for $850.
Barrel:   A proprietary blend of Hammer forged chrome molly vanadium made by FN that is referred to as "Machine Gun Steel" by virtue of its required use in FN's M249 and M240 weapons.   The hammer forging process work hardens the steel, making it more durable.  In addition, the chrome process for the bore allows for a lining almost twice as thick as a standard M16 for enhanced durability.  Chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a 1/7 twist, M4 barrel extension, and a mid-length gas system.   The Special ultra lightweight profile barrel  has a conventional .750" gas block diameter, is Mil-spec phosphate coated, High Pressure tested and Magnetic Particle inspected.  The weight of the barrel splits the difference between our light profile and our pencil barrel.    Barrel is finished off with a YHM Diamond Rifle length Free float rail, low profile gas block, and A2 flash hider. 
Upper: Forged 7075-T6 A3 AR upper is made to MIL-SPECS and hard coat anodized black for durability. Featuring machined T marks, these uppers are made for us right here in the USA.
Bolt: Bolt is made of 8620 steel. Gas key is secured with grade 8 fasteners and staked per mil-spec. Full-auto profile bolt carrier is parkerized outside, and chrome lined inside.

title: For Sale/Trade:  I.O. Polish AKM with lots of ammo and extras!
location: Ruskin/Sun City/Apollo Beach Area, Tampa/St. Pete, Florida
postcontent: I have a Polish AKM with one Romanian 75 round drum (which functions flawlessly, I might add.) One Tula star original Russian Bakelite magazine, one Tapco 10 round magazine, and eight other magazines assorted from Russian steel mags, Korean steel mags, and two polymer from I.O. which came with the gun. Also including an East German military issued sling, and standard AK cleaning kit. I have two .50 caliber metal ammunition boxes with ABOUT 1,800 rounds total. I'm not counting them. The types of ammo included are TulAmmo steel cased, a small portion of Wolf copper washed steel case, and Romanian military ammunition which was sealed in two spam cans with 700 rounds each. VERY hard to find, I have not seen any for sale. I will include a gun case as well. I have TechSights installed along with a recoil buffer, Tapco G2 trigger, and a Tapco trigger retaining plate. I would value everything I have to about 1,800. These are one of the more accurate AK clones you can find, ranging from 4,5,6 inch groups at 100 yards depending on what ammo is used. I would do 1,500 cash for a straight up sale.

title: For Sale:  Free Urgent News
postcontent:
A bill sponsored by William Pascrell, D-NJ, and Danny Davis, D-IL., would nearly double the current 11 percent tax on handguns, while raising the levy on bullets and cartridges from 11 to 50 percent.

The bill includes the following provisions:
Increase in federal excise tax on handguns (both pistols and revolvers) from 11% to 20%
Increase in federal excise tax on ammunition from 11% to 50%
Increase in NFA tax (pre-’86 autos, SBRs, suppressors, etc.) from $200 to $500
Increase in NFA AOW tax from $5 to $100
Increase in special (occupational) tax for importers, manufacturers, and dealers
Adds semiautomatic pistols “chambered for cartridges commonly considered rifle rounds, configured with receivers commonly associated with rifles and capable of accepting detachable magazines” to the list of items taxable as NFA items (26 USC § 5845)
It must be obvious to everyone now that since Democrats can’t completely ban guns, they want to tax them out of existence.

Source from Shooter's Log Link : http://cheaperthandirt.com/blog/?p=48891&cpage=18#comment-102280
